meanings.sent1: Her delusions about being a superhero made her act recklessly.
meanings.sent2: His delusions about winning the lottery led to disappointment.
meanings.sent3: Despite his delusions of being a famous singer, he couldn't carry a tune.
meanings.sent4: The delusions of grandeur in his mind made him feel invincible.
meanings.sent5: The delusions of monsters under the bed kept the child awake at night.

meanings.definition: A persistent false belief held in the face of strong contradictory evidence
meanings.sent1: The patient's delusions of being a spy persisted despite all evidence to the contrary.
meanings.sent2: Her delusions of being followed by aliens caused her great distress.
meanings.sent3: His delusions of being a world-class chef led to some interesting kitchen experiments.
meanings.sent4: The delusions of impending doom clouded his every decision.
meanings.sent5: The delusions of being able to fly led to a dangerous situation on the rooftop.
